title: 115_hr4852
content: The Act titled "Pay Our Protectors Not Our Politicians Act of 2018" provides continuing appropriations for members of the Armed Forces and employees of the Department of Homeland Security. Appropriations for fiscal year 2018 are provided for members of the Armed Forces and reserve components for active and inactive duty. Appropriations for fiscal year 2018 include necessary funds for pay and allowances for civilian personnel, contractors, and employees of the Department of Defense and Department of Homeland Security supporting members of the Armed Forces. The appropriations for fiscal year 2018 include funds for national security activities, death gratuities, funeral and burial expenses, funeral travel expenses, and housing allowances for dependents of members dying on active duty. The curr_chunk discusses the termination of appropriations and funds made available under title 37, United States Code. It specifies that these funds shall be available until the enactment of an appropriation for the purpose, the enactment of regular appropriations resolution without any appropriation, or January 1, 2019. The term "Secretary concerned" is defined in the section. Members of Congress will have their pay reduced if a government shutdown occurs. Members of Congress will have their pay reduced during a government shutdown, with the reduction based on the number of days the shutdown is in effect. This rule applies to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress and future Congresses, with a special provision for the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress. During a government shutdown, the payroll administrator of Congress will withhold an amount from each Member's compensation based on the number of days the shutdown is in effect, depositing it into an escrow account. During a government shutdown, the payroll administrator of Congress withholds an amount from each Member's compensation based on the shutdown's duration, depositing it into an escrow account. At the end of the congress, any remaining amounts in the escrow account are released to the Members to comply with the Constitution. The Secretary of the Treasury assists the payroll administrators in implementing this section. The section enables payroll administrators to withhold compensation from Members of Congress during a government shutdown. It does not apply after the general election in November 2018. A government shutdown is defined as a lapse in appropriations for any Federal agency. The term "Member of Congress" refers to individuals serving in specific positions under the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946. The Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 allows payroll administrators in Congress to withhold compensation from Members of Congress during a government shutdown. The term "payroll administrator" is defined differently for the House of Representatives and the Senate.
